subject: Re: [junit] * Debuggers if any?
msgSnippet: A JUnit test case is a normal Java class, so any Java debugger will do. I suggest typing Java debugger into your favorite search engine. Good luck.
messageBody:
A JUnit test case is a normal Java class, so any Java debugger will do.
I suggest typing "Java debugger" into your favorite search engine.

Good luck.

*********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********

On 2002-07-24 at 05:48 omineo wrote:

>Hi,
>
>Could anyone of you suggest me a best way to know how to step-in a
>sample test in JUNIT.
>
>To be clear, it is like F7 in Turbo C.
>
>My intention is to find the step wise run of a sample class in JUNIT.
>
>Cheers,
>Omineo
>
